summary: Ecosystem Architecture is a practice integrating philosophy, gender studies, coding, spirituality, arts, and media theory to design non-natural ecosystems. It promotes decentralization, regenerative design, and designed coordination to make such ecosystems healthier and more vibrant, addressing contemporary challenges through practical methods.
excerpt: Ecosystem Architecture blends diverse fields to design and groom non-natural ecosystems, incorporating decentralization and regenerative design for healthier, vibrant systems.
